    • Method Detail

      • initCounter

        void initCounter(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Initialize/Start a new counter.

      • getStatus

        CountStatusInterface getStatus(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Get the status counts from the specified counter.

      • copyCounter

        void copyCounter(UniqueIDInterface from_counter,
               UniqueIDInterface to_counter)
        Copy the from_counter counts to the specified to_counter.

      • copyStatus

        void copyStatus(StatusInterface from_status,
              UniqueIDInterface to_counter)
        Copy the from_status counts to the specified to_counter.

      • sumCounters

        void sumCounters(UniqueIDInterface add_counter,
               UniqueIDInterface to_counter)
        Add the add_counter counts to the specified to_counter. The results are stored in the to_counter.

      • sumStatus

        void sumStatus(StatusInterface add_status,
             UniqueIDInterface to_counter)
        Add the add_status counts to the specified to_counter. The results are stored in the to_counter.

      • diffCounters

        void diffCounters(UniqueIDInterface sub_counter,
                UniqueIDInterface from_counter)
        Substract the sub_counter counts from the specified from_counter. The results are stored in the from_counter.

      • diffStatus

        void diffStatus(StatusInterface sub_status,
              UniqueIDInterface from_counter)
        Substract the sub_status counts from the specified from_counter. The results are stored in the from_counter.

      • clearCounter

        void clearCounter(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Clear all counts on the specified counter.

      • suspendCounter

        void suspendCounter(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Suspend counting on a specific counter.

      • suspendAllCounting

        void suspendAllCounting()
        Suspends counting on ALL counters until counting is resumed with resumeAllCounting. Counters already suspended prior to this call will not resume counting due to a call to resumeAllCounting. You must use resumeCounter to resume counting for these.

      • resumeCounter

        void resumeCounter(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Resume counting on a single counter suspended by suspendCounter. Counting will not resume if suspendAllCounters is still "active". In this case, counting will resume once resumeAllCounting has been called.

      • resumeAllCounting

        void resumeAllCounting()
        Resumes counting suspended by suspendAllCounting. Counters specifically suspended by suspendCounter are NOT resumed. You must use resumeCounter to resume counting for these.

      • incrementAllCounters

        void incrementAllCounters(UniqueCounterInterface testlevel,
                        long status)
        Increment the Total Records and the appropriate status count for ALL counters.

      • incrementTestFailures

        long incrementTestFailures(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and Test Failures count for the counter.

      • incrementTestWarnings

        long incrementTestWarnings(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and Test Warnings count for the counter.

      • incrementTestPasses

        long incrementTestPasses(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and Test Passes count for the counter.

      • incrementGeneralFailures

        long incrementGeneralFailures(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and General Failures count for the counter.

      • incrementGeneralWarnings

        long incrementGeneralWarnings(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and General Warnings count for the counter.

      • incrementGeneralPasses

        long incrementGeneralPasses(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and General Passes count for the counter.

      • incrementIOFailures

        long incrementIOFailures(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and IO Failure Records count for the counter.

      • incrementTestIOFailures

        long incrementTestIOFailures(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records, Test Failures, and IO Failure Records count for the counter.

      • incrementSkippedRecords

        long incrementSkippedRecords(UniqueCounterInterface counter)
        Increment the Total Records and Skipped Records count for the counter.

      • deleteCounter

        void deleteCounter(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Delete a counter out of storage.

      • setCounterMode

        void setCounterMode(UniqueIDInterface counter,
                  long mode)
        Set a counter's mode. mode==1: count everything (default). mode==2: count only STEP level results.

      • getCounterMode

        long getCounterMode(UniqueIDInterface counter)
        Get a counter's mode. mode==1: count everything (default). mode==2: count only STEP level results.
